description: Master the Django Template Language (DTL): Inheritance, Tags, and Filters.

slides.title: Django Template Language (DTL)
slides.content:
# Dynamic HTML üé®

DTL allows you to generate HTML dynamically.

It's designed to be comfortable for those used to HTML.

Variables: `{{ variable }}`
Tags: `{% tag %}`

slides.title: Variables
slides.content:
# Display Data üìä

Output a value passed from the view.

`{{ user.username }}`

If the variable is a dictionary, lookup by key. If object, lookup by attribute. If list, lookup by index (`{{ list.0 }}`).

slides.title: Tags
slides.content: # Logic üß† Perform loops, if statements, etc.

slides.title: Filters
slides.content:
# Modify Data üõ†Ô∏è

Transform variables before display using a pipe `|`.

- `{{ name|lower }}`: Lowercase.
- `{{ bio|truncatewords:30 }}`: First 30 words.
- `{{ date|date:"D d M Y" }}`: Format date.

slides.title: Inheritance
slides.content:
# The Power Move ‚ö°

Don't repeat HTML structure.

1. Create `base.html` with blocks.
2. Child templates `extend` it.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
{# base.html #}
<body>
    {% block content %}{% endblock %}
</body>
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Includes
slides.content:
# Components üß©

Load a snippet of HTML into another template.

`{% include "nav.html" %}`

Useful for headers, footers, and sidebars.

slides.title: Static Files
slides.content: # CSS & Images üñºÔ∏è Serve assets. 1. `{% load static %}` at top. 2. `` Django handles URLs automatically.

slides.title: URL Names
slides.content:
# No Hardcoded Links üîó

Use the `url` tag with the view name.

`href="{% url 'post_detail' post.id %}"`

If you change the URL in `urls.py`, the link updates automatically.

slides.title: Custom Tags
slides.content:
# Extending DTL üîå

You can create your own tags and filters in python files inside `templatetags/` directory of your app.

slides.title: Linking Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Why should you use the `{% url %}` tag instead of hardcoding paths like `/about/`?
quizOptions: It makes the page load faster
It prevents broken links if you change the URL pattern in urls.py

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Templates üìë

Presentation Layer.

- **Var:** `{{ }}`
- **Tags:** `{% %}`
- **Filters:** `|`
- **Inheritance:** `block` and `extends`.
